meanings.definition: A type of limbless amphibian resembling a worm or snake.
meanings.sent1: Coecilians are unique creatures that look like a mix of a worm and a snake.
meanings.sent2: I learned about coecilians in science class; they are limbless amphibians.
meanings.sent3: The coecilians decided to have a dance-off with the worms to see who could move better without limbs.
meanings.sent4: In the dark, the coecilians slithered through the mud like shadowy serpents.
meanings.sent5: The children were fascinated by the coecilians at the zoo, mistaking them for elongated worms.

meanings.definition: Any member of the order Gymnophiona, which includes the coecilians.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study coecilians to learn more about the order Gymnophiona.
meanings.sent2: The zookeeper explained that coecilians are part of the Gymnophiona group.
meanings.sent3: The Gymnophiona meeting was crashed by a group of rowdy coecilians.
meanings.sent4: In the forest, the Gymnophiona moved gracefully, led by the coecilians.
meanings.sent5: The documentary showcased the diverse species within the Gymnophiona, including the fascinating coecilians.
